dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Over 1.152 million ethnic Kazakhs have returned to their historical homeland since 1991, according to the Ministry of Labor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Over one point one five two million ethnic Kazakhs have returned to their historical homeland since nineteen ninety one, according to the Ministry of Labor.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 1.152 million ethnic Kazakhs have returned to their historical homeland since 1991, the ministry reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and just in the first part of this year, they've already granted kandas status to, uh, 4,427 people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and just in the first part of this year, they've already granted kandas status to, uh, four thousand, four hundred twenty seven people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the ministry, a total of 4,427 ethnic Kazakhs have returned to Kazakhstan and obtained kandas status since the beginning of 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty significant number, especially when you consider that, like, nearly 5,600 people received that status just between December and May.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty significant number, especially when you consider that, like, nearly five thousand, six hundred people received that status just between December and May.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This means that nearly 5,600 people have received the status between December 1, 2024, and May 1, 2025 " an increase of about 0.5 percent.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And most of them are of working age, right? I think the ministry said almost 60 percent.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And most of them are of working age, right? I think the ministry said almost sixty percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of May 1, 2025, 59.7 percent of returnees are of working age, 31.9 percent are underage, and 8.4 percent are retirees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly—59.7 percent, which makes sense given the focus on labor-deficit regions like Akmola and Kostanay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactlyminus fifty nine point seven percent, which makes sense given the focus on labor-deficit regions like Akmola and Kostanay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As of May 1, 2025, 59.7 percent of returnees are of working age, 31.9 percent are underage, and 8.4 percent are retirees. Ethnic Kazakhs have settled across various regions, with a focus on labor-deficit areas such as Akmola, Abai, Kostanay, Pavlodar, Atyrau, West Kazakhstan, East Kazakhstan, and North Kazakhstan regions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, they're really targeting those areas for settlement. The quota for this year is something like 2,309 people for those regions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, they're really targeting those areas for settlement. The quota for this year is something like two thousand, three hundred nine people for those regions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For 2025, the settlement quota for these regions is set at 2,309 people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the support they'repatriates get is pretty substantial—a relocation subsidy of about 275,000 tenge per family member.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the support they'repatriates get is pretty substantial-a relocation subsidy of about two hundred seventy five thousand tenge per family member.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This includes a one-time relocation subsidy of 70 MCI (approximately 275,200 tenge) per family member, as well as monthly housing and utility allowances of 15 to 30 MCI (about 59,000 to 118,000 tenge) for up to one year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Plus monthly housing allowances for up to a year, which can go up to around 118,000 tenge. That's a huge help for families starting over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus monthly housing allowances for up to a year, which can go up to around one hundred eighteen thousand tenge. That's a huge help for families starting over.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This includes a one-time relocation subsidy of 70 MCI (approximately 275,200 tenge) per family member, as well as monthly housing and utility allowances of 15 to 30 MCI (about 59,000 to 118,000 tenge) for up to one year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And with over 18,000 returnees just last year, you can see how this program's growing steadily.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And with over eighteen thousand returnees just last year, you can see how this program's growing steadily.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2024 alone, 18,035 ethnic Kazakhs were granted kandas status, bringing the total number of returnees since independence to approximately 1.146 million by the end of last year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I wonder how many are coming from specific countries this year—the data must be pretty detailed by now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I wonder how many are coming from specific countries this year-the data must be pretty detailed by now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. The fact that they break it by age and region shows how strategic the settlement process has become.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. The fact that they break it by age and region shows how strategic the settlement process has become.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's not just about returning; it's about integrating them where they're needed most.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's not just about returning; it's about integrating them where they're needed most.
